intro: Hibbertia argentea var. diffusa, commonly known as the silver-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. Hibbertia argentea var. diffusa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in native ecosystems.
